title: How to write unique content about anything - Quora

response.answer_text: Writing “unique” content is becoming harder and harder with each passing year. In fact, being “good” or “unique” doesn’t cut it anymore. The web is saturated with “great content” already. Expect that majority of content that you find on the Google’s first or second (do you even go there?) page is basic-level knowledge.  Whenever I look for something, I end up scanning these pieces more than reading. I check sub-headings and quite often it’s enough to determine that this particular piece isn’t adding anything new to things that I know. Whenever you want to find quality, or you’d say, unique pieces… well, that’s research waiting for you. And a long one, too. But how do you create a unique piece? You could write a whole essay on it, but here’s a quick recap. All in all, you’ll want to include elements that nobody else can copy. Here’s how. Include data you’ve gathered (conduct a research). Basing your claims on data and numbers is cool in itself, but it’s your own research, study and findings that are most valuable.Interview people. Ask for quotes and advice from authority in your industry. These quotes will be found only in your piece and nowhere else.Share your experiences and stories. Nobody has the same experience and knowledge as you do. Your perspective is unique so go ahead and share it with others - and if it somehow helps them, even better. People can learn from your mistakes and events from your past.Give it a twist. The best writers attract our attention with plot twists and unexpected turns of events. We cling to them because we don’t know what to expect on the next page. Following the same rule: want to write a food guide for tourists in Florence? Pretty sure someone already discussed all the restaurants, so why not touch on eating street food only or other unexpected and extreme solution?As said above, it’s not easy to create unique piece of content because with everybody’s having access to web these days, we’re flooded with content on pretty much anything. Will it take time? Yes, it will. Will it be hard? Definitely. Will it pay off? Probably. And I say probably, because the last tip I’ve got for you is to remember that being unique won’t guarantee your copy’s success. The most popular products aren’t those which are the best - but those with the best marketing. So, get to promoting or all your effort will be wasted. I hope this helps! P.S. If you need more tips, you can check out my answer to How to Improve My Content Marketing Skills as well!

Find some experience in your own life that you find interesting, but as Dennis Hopper said in a forgotten film, “Just because it happened to you, doesn’t make it interesting.” It’s an old cliche tha you can’t cross the same stream twice, as the water will always have a different temperature and different fish swimming. Every McDonalds all over the world is essentially the same as well. The key is to focus on what John Travolta called “the little differences.” So don’t try to write something that’s never been written before. Try to find the little differences from your own unique perspective.
